pull.title: [24.x] rpc: treat univalue type check error as RPC_TYPE_ERROR, not RPC_MISC_ERROR
pull.body: Not sure if we want to backport this, but if we do, this is the identical commits from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25737

verification.payload:
tree 5a8240923ad568e30388205f567798f88ab08095
parent f523df1ee8661e0c4738694b9054952769bfff65
author furszy <matiasfurszyfer@protonmail.com> 1663168438 -0300
committer furszy <matiasfurszyfer@protonmail.com> 1663248293 -0300

rpc: treat univalue type check error as RPC_TYPE_ERROR, not RPC_MISC_ERROR

By throwing a custom exception from `Univalue::checkType` (instead of a plain
std::runtime_error) and catching it on the RPC server request handler.

So we properly return RPC_TYPE_ERROR (-3) on arg type errors and
not the general RPC_MISC_ERROR (-1).

rpc: remove unneeded RPCTypeCheckArgument checks

No-behavior change.

Since #25629, we check the univalue type internally.

events.body: What if we just take the first commit, and leave the redundant checks in place for 24.x?

issue.title: rpc: Strict type checking for RPC boolean parameters

comments.body: This is a behavior change. Previously it would throw on non-bool, now it will translate it to false
Sounds like a bug in our UniValue fork that will affect master as well?
